The Buddha told Shariputra:

If there are good sons, good women, and others who hear the names of these buddhas and tathagatas in this sutra, listen to them single-mindedly and truthfully, either recollecting them themselves, or copying, reciting, and explaining them to others, when their lives end they will not fall into evil destinies, will not be born in borderlands, with wrong views, in evil precepts, or in low-caste families, will not be born among long-lived gods, will not be born in the five turbidities, evil worlds, in famines, diseases, or wars, and will not have the difficulties of kings, water, fire, thieves, tigers, wolves, and so forth;

They will always be born in buddha-lands, in the heavens, and among humans. Their physical appearance will be upright and dignified, their faculties complete, their retinue perfect, they will attain the knowledge of past lives, possess the six perfections, practice the four immeasurables, penetrate all the profound Dharma treasures, and accomplish the supreme path.

After the Buddha had spoken this sutra, the great bodhisattvas, Shariputra and the other bhikshus, devas, humans, asuras and others, having heard what the Buddha had said, all greatly rejoiced, believed and received it respectfully.
